title: RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health
Interview Descriptions: Two-round panel interviews with other 4-5 candidates and several interviewers. All of the questions were behavior questions. Questions were in different categories, and everyone got different questions in the same category.
Interview Questions: Such as a difficult situation.

title: New Grad RN Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied in May and heard back for interviews by the end of July. There were two rounds and I would say that they were equally difficult. Interviews were conducted in a group format over Zoom and each candidate was asked a different question from a series of categories (EBP, innovation/leadership, compassionate care, critical thinking, etc). Questions were lengthy and detailed! The pressure was on!
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time in which a family experienced your compassionate care.

title: Nurse Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with manager, virtual interview with team (rapid fire scenario questions), interview with attending physician. I wish the interview was in person and that I had more time to ask questions myself.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you encountered counter transference

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health
Interview Descriptions: The managers were friendly and inviting. I felt I had plenty opportunity for them to get to know me. I do feel afterwards the process of being accepted/declined can be communicated better.
Interview Questions: Previous work experience and what you like and disliked about it

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health
Interview Descriptions: Professional, fast, and easy to navigate. The team was still in the process of defining the position, but they were able to communicate well with me throughout the process and were quickly responsive to my inquiries.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work with this specific team?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Recruiting, vetting and placement was through a personnel agency, so the actual interview with the hiring manager/direct supervisor at LPCH was a quick ~30 min. Zoom meeting. The actual interview process was speedy, although the background checks, documentation and health checks/immunization updates needed via the personnel agency took a total of 1.5 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Group interview setting with multiple nursing managers and educators. It was very organized but a challenging experience because I felt like I was competing with the other interviewer for the position.
Interview Questions: A time you worked in a group where someone didn’t do their part

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health
Interview Descriptions:
Behavioral interview with 1-3 supervisor/managers. They will ask what you what you like about/why accounting. May ask about accruals and true ups.
There will be an excel test that includes pivot tables, vlookup, and filtering.
Interview Questions: What interests you about accounting?

title: Fellowship Program Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed and organized interview process. There are several different panels and a lot of information is available on the fellowship website for the organization. Each of the interviews is usually in panels except for 1 or 2 of them which might be individual interviews for executives.
Interview Questions: Very important to understand why you want to be at this organization and what makes you a good fit!

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the full social work team for that department (approximately ten social workers),  which was super intimidating. Lots of faces to be attentive to! The style was a mix of questions and some vignettes/triaging activities.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize your work?

title: Registered Nurse New Grad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health
Interview Descriptions: Group interview over zoom after application packet submitted. It was a three month long process after submitting application. Submitted in May, interviews in July and notified at the end of July
Interview Questions: A time you used teamwork; a conflict; diverse patient

title: Senior UC Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Stanford, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions:
3 rounds of Interviews.

Panel Interview (technical round), Hiring Manager Interview and then with the director of Information technology. 
Questions were mostly about how I approach technical issues within UC environment and 3rd party integrations for the Telehealth platform
Interview Questions: Questions were mostly about how I approach technical issues within UC environment

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health
Interview Descriptions:
Initial 

Panel Interview - 4 new grads + variety of nurse managers, educators, coordinators 

4 questions total given based on themes: EBP, QI, Teamwork, Compassion and time to ask panel 1 question
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you implemented a QI Project

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with three other new grads. It was virtual and there were 5 interviewers. Each of us asked 4-5 different behavioral and evidence-based questions requiring real-life examples and clinical scenarios.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had a patient with conflicting personal beliefs and how did you respond?

title: New Graduate RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: 4 behavioral questions asked by 3 unit managers along with 3 other new grads. Questions based around topics of compassion, quality improvement, evidence based practice, critical thinking, teamwork, and cultural differences.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about a time you advocated for a patient.
Tell us about a time you weren't communicating well in a team.
Tell us about a time you provided compassionate care.
Tell us about a time you used data collection to care for a patient.

title: Transplant Coordinator (RN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Completed application online. Received call about 1 month later from clinic nurse manager to set up 3 Zoom interviews (due to COVID-19). One panel was with the clinic nurse manager and 2 physicians. The next was with 3 current transplant coordinators. The last was with 3 physicians.
Interview Questions: How have you handled a difficult situation with a team member in the past?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 4 nurse managers and a recruiter as well as 2-3 other interviewees. We had to "interview" each other and report back what we learned. Each person was asked 4 behavioral and evidenced based questions. No one was asked the same question.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you collected or observed a collection of data or audits and what was your role in it.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 4-5 Stanford employees with 3-4 candidates interviewing at the same time. They would go down the line of candidates and ask them each one question, and then move on to the next candidate with a different question. Each candidate had 4 questions. You also interview another candidate and introduce them to the panel.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you provided compassionate care

title: Medical Interpreter and Translator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions: First I had to do an initial phone interview with one person. Then there was an exam with both written and oral components that took a few hours. The exam was proctored. After this, I had an afternoon of interviews with two panels, one larger panel made up of colleagues and the other smaller panel with  coordinators and the manager. They took their time but didn' t draw things up too much.
Interview Questions: They asked things like tell us about a challenging situation and how you addressed it, tell us about a conflict with a colleague and how you addressed it. The interviewers are kind but aren't afraid to ask hard questions or seek clarification, which is what ramped up the difficulty level.

title: RN New Grad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Menlo Park, CA)
Interview Descriptions: You sit down with 4 new grads, a full panel, and you each get asked four to five questions randomly in the panel. Most were clinical story and personality based.
Interview Questions: time you provided compassionate care, what was the outcome

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: There were two separate interviews with basic interview questions. They were very nice. Seemed more like a conversation and them wanting to get to know you more. They had a lot of interviews so it took them a while to get back to me.
Interview Questions: What is a weakness

title: Sales Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview took place at a cafe with the Director.  It lasted much longer than typical, particularly given the setting and the fact that it was with one person, but overall it was an easy interview.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in your next role?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel interview with 4 nurse managers and 4 new graduates. We first interviewed each other as to where we went to school, why we chose nursing, and why this hospital. Then we introduced each other to the panel. We were each asked four questions from each manager, and were allowed 2 minutes to answer.
Interview Questions: What is a word you would use to describe yourself as a team member?

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone interview 
2. In person interview 
I just interviewed today but if selected a 3rd interview with panel is expected for final process  
Overall experience with interviewer was great. And I pray I get the job.  It would be a dream to work at Stanford.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation a work where a customer or patient was unhappy and how did you handle /resolve situation

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was called in to interview 2 months after I submit my application.  All managers were very nice and welcoming. It was a group interview with 4 managers and 4 new grads.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had a conflict with a coworker

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Stanford, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The first interview is a group interview with a total of 4 candidates. Had 4 managers from the respective unit. Everybody had to answer 4 questions that are from different categories + introduce your partner who sat next to you. If they like you, they will contact you for a second interview, which includes other nurse managers, care coordinator, etc.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you advocated for your patient.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview, take turns answering questions; 4 categories of different types of questions. You sit with a group of other applicants.  They have you wait outside together, I noticed there's a camera, possibly to observe you.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you used Quality Improvement in your patient care.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of 6 interviewers on the panel, and 4 nurses being interviewed. They took turns asking everyone different questions. The staff was very personable. The questions were all behavior based.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a contribution to a workplace quality initiative...  Tell us about a time you conveyed compassion to a patient...

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by to Radiology supervisors. They asked a variety questions and asked about how I felt about commuting, but neglected to let me know that there would be constant radiation exposure due to the fact that you need to hold patients.
Interview Questions: Questions of how to deal with different types of conflict

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The application was submitted through a recruiter. An initial screening with the recruiter was followed by a phone interview with the hiring managers. The process from initial screening to offer took approximately two weeks.
Interview Questions: Give a scenario where you had a disagreement with someone. How did you resolve it?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview alongside 3 other applicants and 4 people from management for a unit. Applicants were asked to introduce another applicant to the panel after observing 2 minutes of communication. Each applicant was asked four different questions. The questions varied in difficulty.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about a time when you were unable to provide evidence based care because of a patient's beliefs? What did you do and what was the end result?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Stanford, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview with 3 other new grads and 5 panelists, questions asked one at a time, each interviewee is asked a different topic related to one subject area (ex. patient advocacy, teamwork, delegation/leadership, and evidence based research is very important to this institution)
Interview Questions: Describe a time you provided compassionate care.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Menlo Park, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied during the open period in Feb, got a call in May and had an interview the end of May. It was a panel interview with 4 nurse managers, but also 3 other new graduates who are applying for the same unit as you. They have pre-printed questions that they ask each personal individually, and ask that you keep your answers to 3 minutes or under to give everyone time to speak. At the end each person gets a few minutes to ask questions to the panel.
Interview Questions: Can you tell us of a time when you implemented quality improvement on your unit?

title: Clinical Clerical Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health
Interview Descriptions: Email received after more than a few months of applying. This is the standard at Stanford. Came in to interview you just he manager then the following week interview with a panel: providers & staff.
Interview Questions: Tel us about a time where you made a mistake and how you fixed it?

title: Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring interview consisted of an initial phone call screening conducted by multiple people and then a face to face interview, usually after a week and depending on the need of a new person the process of in-boarding can be fast, one to two weeks. there are a lot of turn around of employees.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with routing protocols

title: New Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview. You will be interviewing along side with three other candidates. Total of eight people in the room. Two parts to the first interview. First part you will be given basic questions to ask your fellow candidate and report back to the panel. Second part, each panel person asks a question from a specific topic. You will take turns to answer different questions.
Interview Questions: All behavioral questions. Describe a time when...

title: RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Contacted via email for group interview. 1 hour long. Initial Interview with 4 managers and 4 new graduate RN. Each new grad asked different questions with similar topics (compassion/ time management/prioritization/ critical thinking etc). Each candidate asked a total of 4 questions. Contacted a few weeks later regarding candidacy status.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you advocated for a patient.

title: Patient Experience Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Had Two 1:1 in person in interviews which were pretty typical questions and you learn more about the position.. then a panel interview with the whole team and they each go around asking a question off of a sheet.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What do you hope to learn from this position? What is your understanding of this position?

title: E-learning Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Menlo Park, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone screener with HR and hiring manager. In-person interview with HR and hiring manager that lasted 50min. The phone screener was very brief and asked about experience and interest in the company. The in-person interview was much more in-depth and they asked a variety of questions related to skills and experience. Also showed some of my work.
Interview Questions: Scenario based questions.

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very long (over 6 months!) and very unorganized. I had a phone screening, an odd phone interview with the hiring manager on a weekend, followed by 4 in person interviews and a secondary application. I actually never heard back from the recruiter or hiring manager despite following up with them several times.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were pretty general: tell us about your experience, what would you do as a manager here, etc.

title: Versant New Grad Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: They held panel interviews of 8 interviewers to 4 candidates. They were very friendly when we walked in the room and kept it light and funny. However, it seems like some of them have more say than others. Also, looking around the room (and the units), there seems to be more people of Caucasian descent than any others. There was some Latino/Hispanic employees, but hardly any Asians, and I don't think I saw any African Americans. I know they aren't allowed to discriminate, but I have to say I definitely felt discouraged. Lo and behold, I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were on a team and things didn't go well.

title: Clinical Nurse Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I did some of my student rotations here and knew the staff at the clinic and was asked to apply. I submitted my online application, including a resume, which included a lengthy personality questionnaire. Then I got a call from HR to set up an interview time.  The panel interview was with the manager, person with the position behing hired for, and other interdisciplinary members. When I got the offer, I had to do a occupational health screening at their facility which included immunization review/administration, blood work, urine test, and physical. I also had to complete a background check.
Interview Questions: Nursing Clinical Scenarios

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health
Interview Descriptions: The process took awhile but the Hiring managers and HR made it easier.
Interview Questions: Long process

title: Performance Improvement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Stanford, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: The different persons who interviewed were very kind and willing to answer any questions I had about the position. During the interview, they really took the time to get to know me, my goals and objectives, and how I would contribute to their organization.
Interview Questions: What achievement are you proudest of, and how would this show us how you would contribute to our department?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Medicine Children’s Health (Palo Alto, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted to be interviewed for the position and they were shocked I agreed to come in and meet personally.  The other candidates had a phone interview with the panel of Managers and Directors.  The second interview was two different panel interviews with different staff members.
Interview Questions: How do you micro-manage without micro-managing?
